docs.lead_paragraph: A draft decision by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services would extend coverage for CT scans to Medicare beneficiaries who smoked at least a pack a day for 30 years or the equivalent.

headline.main: Medicare Proposes Paying for Lung Cancer Screenings for Older Longtime Smokers
headline.print_headline: Medicare Proposes Paying for Lung Cancer Screenings for Older Longtime Smokers

docs.abstract: Medicare will cover annual screenings for lung cancer for four million older Americans with long history of heavy smoking; draft decision by Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services will extend coverage for CT scans to Medicare beneficiaries who smoked at least a pack a day for 30 years or the equivalent.
docs.snippet: A draft decision by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services would extend coverage for CT scans to Medicare beneficiaries who smoked at least a pack a day for 30 years or the equivalent.

docs.lead_paragraph: The case involves a union contract at a plant in West Virginia and whether health benefits for retirees would vest.

headline.main: Supreme Court Weighs Case Over Cuts to Retirees’ Health Benefits
headline.print_headline: Supreme Court Weighs Case Over Cuts to Retirees’ Health Benefits

docs.abstract: Supreme Court seems puzzled about why it is being asked to decide whether chemical company M&G Polymers USA can cut health benefits of its retired workers; case involves a union contract at a plant in West Virginia and whether health benefits for retirees would vest.
docs.snippet: The case involves a union contract at a plant in West Virginia and whether health benefits for retirees would vest.

headline.main: Estimate of Health Coverage Enrollment Leaves Room to Grow
headline.print_headline: Estimate of Health Coverage Enrollment Leaves Room to Grow

docs.abstract: Health Sec Sylvia Mathews Burwell offers surprisingly modest estimate of number of people who will sign up for health insurance in second round of open enrollment; says 9.1 million people will have such coverage at end of 2015.

docs.lead_paragraph: The U.S. administration on Monday dramatically cut expectations for 2015 Obamacare enrollment, saying it aims to have a total of 9.1 million people enrolled in government-backed federal and state health insurance marketplaces next year.
